item.title: 交易商关注美国大选和拉斐尔风暴，石油保持涨势
item.description: 由于市场关注紧张的美国总统大选以及热带风暴拉斐尔对墨西哥湾生产造成的威胁，石油在连续五天上涨后持稳。【原文：Oil was steady after a five-day run of gains as the market monitored a tight US presidential election and Tropical Storm Rafael menaced production in the Gulf of Mexico.】

item.title: 投票临近，亚洲股市将追随美国股市涨势：市场综述
item.description: 继美国大选日股市上涨之后，亚洲股市也将高开，交易商们在等待一场对全球贸易和经济持不同观点的总统竞选结果。由于投资者在投票结果出炉前进行了对冲，预期波动率悄然上升。【原文：Asian stocks were set for a higher open following election-day gains in the US, as traders hunkered down awaiting results in a presidential race pitting divergent visions of global trade and the economy. Gauges of expected volatility crept up amid hedging by investors before an outcome that remained too close for pollsters to call.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体季度销售额低迷，亏损不断增加
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的媒体公司在第三季度继续亏损，因为在周二大选前的几个月里，收入涓滴未进。【原文：Donald Trump’s media company continued to lose money in the third quarter as revenue trickled in during the months ahead of Tuesday’s election.】

item.title: 美国投票结束前日本股市期货走高
item.description: 日本股票期货攀升，因为投资者正在等待将对全球经济产生影响的美国总统大选结果。【原文：Japanese stock futures climbed, as investors braced for the outcome of the US presidential election that will have implications for the global economy.】

item.title: 交易员在国债反弹的最后一刻大量押注利率
item.description: 债券投资者纷纷参与将从国债反弹中获利的交易，对卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）更有可能赢得美国总统大选的情况进行定价，同时减少了被认为有利于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）获胜的押注。【原文：Bond investors are piling into trades that would profit from a rally in Treasuries, pricing in a scenario viewed as more likely under a US presidential victory by Kamala Harris while paring back bets seen as favoring a win by Donald Trump.】

item.title: Netflix 巴黎和阿姆斯特丹办事处因税务欺诈案被搜查
item.description: 据一名法国司法部官员称，调查人员周二突袭了 Netflix 公司在巴黎和阿姆斯特丹的办事处，这是 2022 年对涉嫌税务犯罪和未申报劳动的调查的一部分。【原文：Netflix Inc. offices in Paris and Amsterdam were raided on Tuesday by investigators as part of a 2022 probe into alleged tax-related crimes and undeclared labor, according to a French justice ministry official.】

item.title: 大选结果出炉，银行彻夜兜售信贷交易
item.description: 随着可能影响公司利润的总统和立法选举结果陆续揭晓，银行正在为深夜的美国信贷交易做准备。【原文：Banks are gearing up for late-night US credit trades as results trickle in from presidential and legislative elections that could impact company profits.】

item.title: 超微因销售前景低于预期而下滑
item.description: 超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer Inc.该公司股价在延时交易中下跌了约 10%。【原文：Super Micro Computer Inc. gave a sales forecast that fell short of analysts’ estimates while saying it couldn’t predict when it would file official financial statements for its previous fiscal year. The shares dropped about 10% in extended trading.】

item.title: 激进投资者 TOMS 增持 WillScot 股份，推动审查
item.description: 知情人士透露，TOMS Capital 投资管理公司已入股模块化建筑和仓储供应商 WillScot Holdings Corp.【原文：TOMS Capital Investment Management has built a stake in WillScot Holdings Corp., a provider of modular buildings and storage, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 华尔街指望股市在大选障碍后反弹
item.description: 越来越多的华尔街策略师预测，美国总统大选的结果将为股市在 2024 年底的反弹奠定基础，而 S&P 500 指数今年的涨幅已达 21%。【原文：A growing number of Wall Street strategists are predicting that a decision in the US presidential election will set the stage for stocks to rally into the end of 2024, building on a 21% gain this year for the S&P 500 Index.】

item.title: 新业务提升销售额后，Coupang 的收入攀升
item.description: Coupang Inc.连续第七个季度实现销售额两位数增长，这主要得益于其食品配送等新兴业务的推动。【原文：Coupang Inc. reported double-digit sales growth for the seventh consecutive quarter, propelled by its nascent business forays such as food deliveries.】

item.title: 英伟达乘人工智能浪潮超越苹果成为全球最大公司
item.description: 本周二，英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp. ）超越苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：Nvidia Corp. became the largest company in the world on Tuesday, surpassing Apple Inc. and underscoring just how dominant artificial intelligence has become on Wall Street.】

item.title: 夏威夷电力公司敲定 20 亿美元毛伊岛火灾和解协议
item.description: 一场野火夷平了历史名镇拉海纳（Lahaina），造成 100 多人死亡，夏威夷电气工业公司正式签署了一项价值 20 亿美元的协议，以解决野火造成的损失索赔。【原文：Hawaiian Electric Industries formalized a $2 billion agreement to settle damage claims from a wildfire that razed the historic town of Lahaina and killed more than 100 people.】

item.title: 苹果公司将面临欧盟数字市场法案规定的首张罚单
item.description: 根据欧盟针对大型科技公司的新数字反垄断规则，苹果公司将面临有史以来的第一笔罚款，这意味着苹果公司因其利润丰厚的 App Store 的主导地位而与监管机构的冲突升级。【原文：Apple Inc. is set to face the first-ever fine under the European Union’s new digital antitrust rules for Big Tech, representing an escalation of a clash with regulators over the dominance of its hugely profitable App Store.】

item.title: Golub Capital 将四项 CLO 合并为有史以来最大的重置项目
item.description: 资产管理公司 Golub Capital 上周末发行了有记录以来规模最大的重置抵押贷款债务，该债务由多个 CLO 合并而成。【原文：Asset manager Golub Capital issued the largest reset of a collateralized loan obligation on record late last week, created through an amalgamation of multiple CLOs.】

item.title: 惠誉重申秘鲁投资级评级并上调评级展望
item.description: 惠誉周二确认了秘鲁的投资级评级，缓解了人们对这个南美国家正向垃圾级迈进的担忧。【原文：Fitch affirmed Peru’s investment-grade rating on Tuesday, assuaging concern that the South American nation was headed closer to junk.】

item.title: 尼尔森智库考虑 IPO，估值接近 100 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，尼尔森智库（NielsenIQ）正在探索首次公开发行股票的可能性，这家消费者情报公司的估值可能在 100 亿美元左右，因为首次公开发行股票的市场继续回暖。【原文：NielsenIQ is exploring an initial public offering that could value the consumer intelligence firm at about $10 billion, according to people familiar with the matter, as the market for first-time share sales continues a comeback.】

item.title: 欧佩克+会议推迟后，阿美石油公司下调 12 月亚洲油价
item.description: 在欧佩克+（OPEC+）产油国集团成员表示将把增产推迟一个月之后，沙特阿拉伯下调了亚洲买家 12 月份的油价。【原文：Saudi Arabia lowered oil prices for buyers in Asia for December after members of the OPEC+ producers group said they will push back production increases by one month.】

item.title: 意大利电信首席执行官致力于电话运营商的扭亏计划
item.description: 意大利电信公司（Telecom Italia SpA）首席执行官皮埃特罗-拉布里奥拉（Pietro Labriola）表示，他将致力于完成这家电话运营商的扭亏为盈计划，在此之前，他在一项具有里程碑意义的交易中削减了该公司的债务负担，并于今年出售了其网络。【原文：Telecom Italia SpA Chief Executive Officer Pietro Labriola said he is committed to seeing through the phone carrier’s turnaround plan after he slashed its debt load in a landmark deal to sell its network this year.】

item.title: 大批日间交易员正在为大选日的混乱做准备
item.description: 随着美国大选搅动市场，众多零售交易平台警告用户，周二他们可能会面临交易中断。【原文：A bevy of retail trading platforms have warned users that they could face disruptions on Tuesday as the US election roils markets.】

item.title: 预测市场的现场实验
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 部长称哥伦比亚将在 2025 年避免天然气短缺
item.description: 哥伦比亚能源部长表示，这个南美国家明年在获取天然气方面不会有任何问题，并保证不会出现能源紧缺的担忧。【原文：Colombia’s energy minister says the South American nation will have no problems getting natural gas next year — offering reassurances that fears of an energy crunch won’t materialize.】

item.title: Peak6 出售英超狼队股份
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Peak6 投资公司已出售其在英超球队伍尔弗汉普顿流浪者队的控股公司中的少数股份。【原文：Peak6 Investments has sold its minority stake in a holding company that operates Premier League team Wolverhampton Wanderers, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 奇数直播：大选之夜及其后的看点
item.description:
关注回报及其经济影响。【原文：

Watching the returns and the economic implications of them.

】

item.title: 奇数直播：大选之夜的看点（播客）
item.description: 今天是美国大选日，因此无需对利害关系做任何真正的解释。昨晚，我们在纽约举办了一场特别的奇点直播活动，我们在台上采访了我们的一些常客，让他们谈谈投票以及未来几天和几年的经济和市场影响— 无论谁获胜。首先，您将听到 Employ America 的斯坎达-阿马尔纳特（Skanda Amarnath）、Re.【原文：It’s Election Day in the US, so there’s no need for any real explanation of what’s at stake. Last night in New York City, we hosted a special live Odd Lots event, where we interviewed some of our regular guests on stage to talk about the vote, as well as the economic and market implications in the days and years ahead — regardless of who wins. First up, you’ll hear a conversation about prediction markets, regular markets, and vote-watching with Skanda Amarnath of Employ America, Neil Dutta of Re】

item.title: 美国大选在即，石油交易商避险 100 美元价格
item.description: 石油交易商抢购美国原油期货看涨押注，以防美国大选后几天中东紧张局势加剧，油价可能飙升至每桶 100 美元。【原文：Oil traders snapped up bullish bets on US crude futures to protect against the chance that prices could spike toward $100 a barrel if Middle East tensions ratchet up in the days after the US election.】

item.title: 展望令人失望，玛克塔跌幅创历史之最
item.description: Marqeta 公司是 Block 和 Affirm 等公司的支付卡合作伙伴，该公司预测第四季度业绩令人失望，股价暴跌 40%。【原文：Shares of Marqeta Inc. tumbled more than 40% after the payment card partner for firms including Block and Affirm forecast disappointing results for the fourth quarter.】

item.title: Lineage 面临年内最大美国 IPO 后的首个盈利障碍
item.description: Lineage 公司在今年美国最大的首次公开募股中筹集了 51 亿美元，该公司的首份季报将是一次关键的考验，因为这家温控存储公司面临着潜在的食品供应需求疲软。【原文：Lineage Inc.’s first quarterly report after raising $5.1 billion in the year’s biggest US initial public offering will be a crucial test, as the temperature-controlled storage firm faces potentially weak demand for food supplies.】

item.title: 英国石油公司出售荷兰公路加油站
item.description: 英国石油公司（BP Plc）计划出售其在荷兰的所有公路加油站和电动汽车充电站，理由是荷兰的增长机会有限。【原文：BP Plc plans to sell all of its road fuel stations and charging hubs for electric cars in the Netherlands, citing limited growth opportunities in the country.】

item.title: 利比亚计划进行 2011 年内战以来的首次石油勘探招标
item.description: 利比亚正在计划自 2011 年内战以来的首次能源勘探合同招标，因为这个欧佩克成员国希望让因多年不稳定和停产而受到惊吓的石油巨头们回心转意。【原文：Libya is planning its first tender for energy exploration contracts since 2011’s civil war, as the OPEC member looks to bring back oil majors spooked by years of instability and production shutdowns.】
